profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-04-06 16:23:47 -0400.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Use of original papers requires an appointment and is limited to the Archives' Washington, D.C., Research Center. Microfilmed materials must be consulted on microfilm.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Biographical material, personal and professional correspondence, writings, three photographs of Rosenquit, and printed material consiting of press reviews.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: An additional 45 items microfilmed on reel 5299 include personal and business letters; four photographs of Rosenquit, 1947-1966, and four photographs of his work; a resum√©, 1976; a draft of a short story by Rosenquit, "An Orderly Suicide," clippings; reproductions; and announcements for shows at the Roko Gallery and elsewhere. Many items are annotated by Rosenquit. Among the correspondents are Ann Freilich, Wendy Owen, Daniele Deverin, and May Swenson.

altformavail.head: Existence and Location of Copies
altformavail.p: 35mm microfilm reel 5299 (fr. 1157-1221) available for use at Archives of American Art offices and through interlibrary loan.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Bernard Rosenquit (1923-1991) was a painter and printmaker in New York , N.Y.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Donated 1976 by Bernard Rosenquit and in 2003 by Vivian Hecht and Pauline Seener, Rosenquit's sisters.
